item.title: Street light on all of the time. Outside 16 Jodami Crescent., 22nd January
item.description:
The light has been on permanently for several weeks.

item.title: 2 deep potholes in Church Road, 22nd January
item.description:
One of the holes was photographed/reported on 5 January. Inevitably in the meantime they have both grown. Cars seen driving into the wrong side of the road to avoid holes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Boleyn Cottages Church Road, Swindon Village

item.description:

item.title: Inadequate lighting provision on Northfield Terrace, 21st January
item.description:
There are two streetlights along the length of the Terrace, neither of which provide enough light for residents to safely navigate the street. Combined with potholes, densely-parked cars, drains and litter in the road, it is challenging at night for pedestrians to use the footpath. Please might it be possible for the lighting along the Terrace to be supplemented with a third street lamp installed for continual illumination? Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 14 Clarence Square, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Derelict pavement on Northfield Terrace, 21st January
item.description:
The length of the pavement along the Terrace is in poor repair, with inadequately maintained painted double yellow lines, frequent incidence of cracking, rubble and broken tarmac, weeds and disintegration. Please could it be examined for repair as it's unsafe for residents to use and has deteriorated substantially over the past few years. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Clarence Lodge Clarence Square, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven and patchy dangerous roadway surface, 21st January
item.description:
This whole street badly needs resurfacing across the length of it. Residents are finding the potholes a significant trip hazard, especially for young children and those with limited mobility. Would it be possible to raise this for a full resurface please as Northfield Terrace has not had one in many years and is in a state of significant disrepair. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Formosa House Northfield Terrace, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Substantial rubbish dumped along Honeybourne Line, 21st January
item.description:
The resident next to this property has an ongoing issue with the adjacent fence that is badly damaged and supposedly managed by Sanctuary Housing who conducted the development of the estate. There have been multiple incidences of flytipping behind the broken fence as it's open access, and now there's a large amount of construction equipment dumped there and covered with brambles. It seems to be self-exacerbating the longer the rubbish persists there. Would it be possible to take a look to see if it could be cleared? Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 41 Marsh Gardens, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Honeybourne Line/ Marsh Drive flytipped childs slide, 21st January
item.description:
There's a bright green plastic slide dumped just off the Honeybourne Line that is cracked and damaged, along with some smaller items I can't see from the road. Please could they be removed? Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 41 Marsh Gardens, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Significant damage to pavement following line installation, 21st January
item.description:
The recent installation of cables/pipes along Marsh Drive has left the pavement in a really bad state - the surface is uneven and patchy, it looks unattractive and there's a risk of sinkage in due course. The corporate installation workers have not done a great job tidying up after themselves, leaving loose grit and stones and displaced tarmac behind them, and the pavement the whole way along the Drive is in shabby condition. Would it be possible to liaise with whoever conducted this work to raise concerns about this and ensure they repair the damages caused? Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 31 Marsh Gardens, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
